metadata.title: CVE-2021-39257 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A crafted NTFS image with an unallocated bitmap can lead to a endlessrecursive function call chain (starting from ntfs_attr_pwrite), causingstack consumption in NTFS-3G < 2021.8.22.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39257` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntfs-3g - 1:2015.3.14AR.1-1ubuntu0.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ntfs-3g package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2015.3.14AR.1-1ubuntu0.3+esm1').
